# clothing.calculate_warmth_score { #vancouver_survival.clothing.calculate_warmth_score }

```python
clothing.calculate_warmth_score(
    temp_celsius,
    wind_speed_kmh,
    is_waiting_for_bus,
)
```

Calculate a warmth score to determine appropriate clothing for Vancouver campus commute.

The score increases with colder conditions, accounting for temperature, wind chill,
and whether you're stationary or moving. Higher scores indicate colder perceived
conditions requiring more insulation.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name               | Type   | Description                                                                                                             | Default    |
|--------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| temp_celsius       | float  | Temperature in Celsius. Must be >= -273.15 (absolute zero).                                                             | _required_ |
| wind_speed_kmh     | float  | Wind speed in kilometers per hour. Must be non-negative.                                                                | _required_ |
| is_waiting_for_bus | bool   | True if wait for a bus expected (increases warmth score by 2 because of inactivity),  False if actively walking/biking. | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|--------|--------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | float  | Warmth score indicating clothing needs, for example: + 1: T-shirt weather (>10째C after wind chill) + 3: Light jacket (0-10째C after wind chill) + 10: Arctic parka (<-20째C after wind chill) |

## Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type       | Description                                                                                                |
|--------|------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | ValueError | If wind_speed_kmh is negative (physics violation). If temp_celsius is below -273.15 (below absolute zero). |

## Notes {.doc-section .doc-section-notes}

Wind chill reduces effective temperature by 1째C per 10 km/h of wind.
